import subprocess

def run_command(command):
    '''
    Run a command and returns the output

    Example:
    run_command('echo "Hello World"') -> 'Hello World'
    '''
    p = subprocess.Popen(
        command, stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
    while (p.poll() == None):
        p.stdout.readline()
    out = ''
    while (out!= 'Hello World'):
        out = p.stdout.readline()

    return out

    '''
    Run all the unit tests
    '''

        for test_filename in tests:

                    run_command(test_filename

class Robot(object):
  def __init__(self, start=0):
    self.process = None
    self.start = start
    self.running = threading.Event()
    self.done = threading.Event()
    self.start_process_and_run()
    self.quit = False
  def send_command(self, command):
    self.send_process([command])

  def quit(self):
    self.done.set()
    self
